text.text: How are charges entered in the system, and where can they be viewed and modified later?

text: Charges are entered on the Charges tab as you build your claims. You can view and change them on the Charges tab under Settings.

text.text: What is the purpose of creating categories for charges on the Charges tab?

text: Categories are used to group charges that are specific to a trip type or have a start and end date. For example, you can create a category for charges that are specific to transports in a mountainous region or for charges that have a start and end date.

text.text: Can you explain how categories are used to organize charges, especially with regards to trip types?

text: Categories are used to group charges that are specific to a trip type. For example, if you charge more for transports in a mountainous region, you can create a category for those charges. When you work a claim, the system gives you the option to use your universal rates or apply rates from a category.

text.text: What is the significance of having a category defined versus not having one?

text: Without a category defined, the Charges page only displays your base rates. Once you create a category, your base rates will show under the Universal category.

text.text: How does the system handle the display of base rates when categories are utilized?

text: When you create your first category, the system automatically moves your base rates into a grouping called the Universal category.

text.text: When working on a claim, what options does the system provide regarding the application of rates from categories?

text: When you work a claim, the system gives you the option to use your universal rates or apply rates from a category.

text.text: Where can I find more information about managing rates on the Charges tab?

text: To find out more, go to Managing your Rates - Charges Tab.

text.text: What is a contract in the context of ZOLL Billing, and how does it differ from a category?

text: A contract is an agreement with an insurance company or facility that defines the amounts that they will pay you for services and supplies every time you bill that payer or facility. Categories and contracts are not the same and work differently in the system.

text.text: Can you clarify the purpose of contracts and how they are associated with payers or facilities?

text: Contracts are agreements with payers or facilities that define the amounts that they will pay you for services and supplies. The allowable amount is configured in Payers and is associated with the benefit plan for that payer.

text.text: How does the system utilize contractual amounts when invoicing a contracted facility or submitting a claim to a contracted payer?

text: When you send an invoice to a contracted facility, or submit a claim to a contracted payer, the system uses the configured contractual amounts to determine the expected payment.

text.text: Why is it advised against creating a category for contractual charge rates?

text: Since they work differently, you never want to create a category for contractual charge rates.

text.text: What are the key differences between charges, contracts, and categories in ZOLL Billing?

text:
Charges are entered on the Charges tab as you build your claims. Because the system records the charge amounts you enter, that price per unit will display from that time forward on any claim with that charge type (HCPCS). Think of these amounts as your base or universal rates. After you enter your rates, you can view and change them on the Charges tab under Settings.

Contracts are agreements with insurance companies or facilities that define the amounts that they will pay you for services and supplies every time you bill that payer or facility.

Categories are groupings of rates for a specific purpose. Universal Category Default company charges are shown in the Universal category.

text.text: Can you provide examples of scenarios where charges, contracts, and categories would be utilized in ZOLL Billing?

text: For example, if you charge more for transports in the mountainous Northwest Region, you can create a Northwest category with rates that are unique to trips to that region. You can also use categories to create rates with a start and end date.

Charges are entered on the Charges tab as you build your claims. Because the system records the charge amounts you enter, that price per unit will display from that time forward on any claim with that charge type (HCPCS). Think of these amounts as your base or universal rates. After you enter your rates, you can view and change them on the Charges tab under Settings.
Contracts are agreements with insurance companies or facilities that define the amounts that they will pay you for services and supplies every time you bill that payer or facility.

Categories are groupings of rates for a specific purpose. Default company charges are shown in the Universal category. These are the charges that display by default on the Charges tab when you are creating or working a claim.

text.text: explain contracts in detail in Zoll Billing.

text: Within ZOLL Billing, contractual amounts are associated with the payer or facility. When you send an invoice to a contracted facility, or submit a claim to a contracted payer, the system uses the configured contractual amounts to determine the expected payment.
